revised_title: New Discoveries on the Glyptodon Specimen
tldr: The author describes a new specimen of the extinct Glyptodon, recently acquired by the Royal College of Surgeons of England. The specimen provides a nearly complete supplement to the previously known fragmentary remains of the species. The author highlights the unique anatomical features of the skull, vertebral column, and pelvis, which offer valuable insights into the structure and evolution of the Glyptodon and its close relatives.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleontology
